sen.j: 神嘗祭（かんなめさい・かんなめのまつり・かんにえのまつり）とは、神宮（伊勢神宮）と宮中の祭礼である。
sen.e: Kannamesai (aka Kanname no Matsuri, Kannie no Matsuri) is a rite and festival of Ise-jingu Shrine and the imperial court.
Kannamesai (aka Kanname no Matsuri, Kannie no Matsuri) is a rite and festival of Ise-jingu Shrine and the imperial court.
Kannamesai (a.k.a. Kanname no Matsuri, Kannie no Matsuri) is a rite and festival of Ise-jingu Shrine and the imperial court.

sen.j: 皇室の大祭で、その年に獲れた新穀を天照大御神に奉る儀式である。
sen.e: It is an imperial grand festival, and a rite to present new grains to Amaterasu Omikami (the Sun Goddess).
It is an imperial grand festival, and a rite to present new grains to Amaterasu Omikami (the Sun Goddess).
It is an imperial grand festival, and a rite to present new grains to Amaterasu Omikami (the Sun Goddess).

sen.j: かつては旧暦9月11日 (旧暦)に勅使に御酒と神饌を授け、旧暦9月17日 (旧暦)に奉納していた。
sen.e: In the past, sacred sake and food offered to the god was given to an imperial envoy on September 11 (old calendar), and it was presented to the god on September 17 (old calendar).
In the past, sacred sake and food offered to the god was given to an imperial envoy on September 11 (old calendar), and it was presented to the god on September 17 (old calendar).
In the past, sacred sake and food offered to the god was given to an imperial envoy on September 11 (old calendar), and it was presented to the god on September 17 (old calendar).

sen.j: 明治5年（1872年）の太陽暦改暦以降は新暦9月17日に実施するようになったが、これでは新穀が間に合わないため、明治12年（1879年）以降は月遅れで新暦10月17日に行われるようになった。
sen.e: After the change to the solar calendar in 1872, the Kannamesai was also changed to be performed on September 17 on the new calendar, which was too early for the new grain, and therefore it was postponed by one month to be performed on October 17 on the new calendar since 1879.

After the change to the solar calendar in 1872, the Kannamesai was also changed to be performed on September 17 on the new calendar, which was too early for the new grain, and therefore it was postponed by one month to be performed on October 17 on the new calendar since 1879.

After the change to the solar calendar in 1872, the Kannamesai was also changed to be performed on September 17 on the new calendar, which was too early for the new grain, and therefore it was postponed by one month to be performed on October 17 on the new calendar since 1879.

sen.j: 古来より、神嘗祭には皇室から神宮に幣帛使が派遣されていたが、応仁の乱以降は中断されることも多くなった。
sen.e: Since the ancient times, the imperial family used to dispatch Heihakushi (a messenger who brings a sacramental strip of paper(silk)) to Ise-jingu Shrine on the Kannamesai, but the dispatch was often stopped after the Onin War.

Since the ancient times, the imperial family used to dispatch Heihakushi (a messenger who brings a sacramental strip of paper(silk)) to Ise-jingu Shrine on the Kannamesai, but the dispatch was often stopped after the Onin War.

Since the ancient times, the Imperial Family used to dispatch Heihakushi (a messenger who brings a sacramental strip of paper (silk)) to Ise-jingu Shrine on the Kannamesai, but the dispatch was often stopped after the Onin War.
sen.cmt: 用語統一スペース挿入

sen.j: 江戸時代に入り正保4年（1647年）に幣帛使の発遣が復活して以降、今日まで途切れることなく発遣が行われている。
sen.e: Since the dispatch of the Heihakushi started again in 1647 in Edo period, the dispatch has continued until now.
Since the dispatch of the Heihakushi started again in 1647 in Edo period, the dispatch has continued until now.
Since the dispatch of the Heihakushi started again in 1647 in Edo period, the dispatch has continued until now.

sen.j: 明治4年以降は皇居の賢所でも神嘗祭の儀式が行われるようになった。
sen.e: Since 1871, the rite of the Kannamesai has been also performed in Kashikodokoro of the imperial court.
Since 1871, the rite of the Kannamesai has been also performed in Kashikodokoro of the imperial court.
Since 1871, the rite of the Kannamesai has been also performed in Kashikodokoro (Palace Sanctuary) of the imperial court.

sen.j: 神嘗祭の儀式に先立って、天皇は宮中三殿の神嘉殿南庇で神宮を遥拝する。
sen.e: Prior to the rite of the Kannamesai, the emperor bows the knee to Ise-jingu Shrine from away in the southern peripheral space of Shinka-den, one of the Three Shrines in the Imperial Court.
Prior to the rite of the Kannamesai, the emperor bows the knee to Ise-jingu Shrine from away in the southern peripheral space of Shinka-den, one of the Three Shrines in the Imperial Court.
Prior to the rite of the Kannamesai, the emperor bows the knee to Ise-jingu Shrine from away in the southern peripheral space of Shinka-den, one of the Three Shrines in the Imperial Court.

sen.j: 明治6年、祝祭日として神嘗祭の行われる日は休日とされた。
sen.e: In 1873, the day of the Kannamesai was made a public holiday as a festal day.
In 1873, the day the Kannamesai was made a public holiday as a festival day.
In 1873, the day the Kannamesai was made a public holiday as a festival day.

sen.j: 戦後は、国民の祝日に関する法律の施行により、国の祝祭日ではなくなり、宮中三殿と神宮（伊勢神宮）で儀式を執り行っている。
sen.e: After the war, due to the enforcement of Act on National Holidays, it is not a national holiday anymore, and the rite is performed only in the Three Shrines in the Imperial Court and Ise-jingu Shrine.

After the war, due to the enforcement of Act on National Holidays, it is not a national holiday anymore, and the rite is performed only in the Three Shrines in the Imperial Court and Ise-jingu Shrine.

After the war, due to the enforcement of Act on National Holidays, it is not a national holiday anymore, and the rite is performed only in the Three Shrines in the Imperial Court and Ise-jingu Shrine.

sen.j: 神宮へは、皇室から幣帛と、勅使（掌典職）が遣わされ、奉幣の儀が奉仕される。
sen.e: The Heihaku and an imperial envoy (ceremonial staff) are dispatched from the imperial family to the Ise-jingu Shrine to service hohei no gi (ceremony for offering a wand with hemp and paper streamers to a Shinto god).

The Heihaku and an imperial envoy (ceremonial staff) are dispatched from the imperial family to the Ise-jingu Shrine to service hohei no gi (ceremony for offering a wand with hemp and paper streamers to a Shinto god).

The Heihaku and an imperial envoy (ceremonial staff) are dispatched from the Imperial Family to the Ise-jingu Shrine to service hohei no gi (ceremony for offering a wand with hemp and paper streamers to a Shinto god).

sen.j: 「神嘗」は「神の饗（あえ）」が変化したものと言われている。
sen.e: Kanname' is said to have been changed from 'Kami no ae.'
Kanname' is said to have been changed from 'Kami no ae.'
Kanname' is said to have been changed from 'Kami no ae.'

sen.j: 「饗え」は食べ物でもてなすという意味の古語である。
sen.e: Ae' is an ancient word that means to offer hospitality with food.
sen.cmt: 文頭のシングルクォテーションは見えなくなるので二重にタイプしてあります。
sen.e: Ae' is an ancient word that means to offer hospitality with food.
Ae' is an ancient word that means to offer hospitality with food.

sen.j: また、饗は新殻を意味する贄（にえ）の転じたものという説もある。
sen.e: There is another opinion that ae was turned from nie that means new grains.
There is another opinion that ae was turned from nie that means new grains.
There is another opinion that ae was turned from nie that means new grains.

sen.j: 神宮では、神嘗祭のときに御装束・祭器具を一新する。
sen.e: In Ise-jingu Shrine, all of the costumes and ceremonial implements are changed to new ones at the time of the Kannamesai.
In Ise-jingu Shrine, all of the costumes and ceremonial implements are changed to new ones at the time of the Kannamesai.
In Ise-jingu Shrine, all of the costumes and ceremonial implements are changed to new ones at the time of the Kannamesai.

sen.j: 神宮の正月ともいわれる。
sen.e: It is also called New Year of Ise-jingu Shrine.
It is also called New Year of Ise-jingu Shrine.
It is also called New Year of Ise-jingu Shrine.

sen.j: 20年に一度行なわれる神宮の式年遷宮は、実は大規模な神嘗祭だと言われている。
sen.e: The transfer of a deity to a new shrine building once in a twenty years is said to be in fact a large scale of Kannamesai.
The transfer of a deity to a new shrine building once in twenty years is said to be in fact large scale Kannamesai.
The transfer of a deity to a new shrine building once in twenty years is said to be in fact large scale Kannamesai.

sen.j: 式年遷宮後最初に行われる神嘗祭は、神宮では「大神嘗祭」とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: In Ise-jingu Shrine, the first Kannamesai after the transfer of the deity is also called 'Okannamesai' meaning great Kannamesai.
In Ise-jingu Shrine, the first Kannamesai after the transfer of the deity is also called 'Okannamesai' meaning great Kannamesai.
In Ise-jingu Shrine, the first Kannamesai after the transfer of the deity is also called 'Okannamesai' meaning great Kannamesai.

sen.j: 伊勢市の民衆は、この祭りを「おおまつり」と呼び、奉祝の各種行事を行う。
sen.e: People in Ise City call the festival 'Omatsuri,' in which various events of celebration are performed.
People in Ise City call the festival 'Omatsuri,' in which various celebration events are performed.
People in Ise City call the festival 'Omatsuri,' in which various celebration events are performed.

sen.j: 神宮の神職や伊勢の神領民はこの祭りが終わるまで新穀を口にしないといわれているが、実際に守られているかどうかは定かではない。
sen.e: It is said that Shinto priests in Ise-jingu Shrine and Shinryomin of Ise do not eat new grain until the festival ends, but it is not known whether the rule is actually kept.
It is said that Shinto priests in Ise-jingu Shrine and Shinryomin of Ise do not eat new grain until the festival ends, but it is not known whether the rule is actually kept.
It is said that Shinto priests in Ise-jingu Shrine and Shinryomin of Ise do not eat new grain until the festival ends, but it is not known whether the rule is actually kept.

sen.j: 秋の季語である。
sen.e: Kannamesai is an autumnal season word.
Kannamesai is an autumnal season word.
Kannamesai is an autumnal season word.
